item.title: Newly undecided voters could be crucial for Harris. And NASA races to save a telescope
item.description: A NPR poll shows that newly undecided voters could be vital in Vice President Harris' campaign to win the 2024 election. And, NASA is hoping to save the most powerful X-ray telescope ever built.

item.title: Tennis star Coco Gauff will carry the U.S. flag at the Olympic opening ceremony
item.description: Gauff, 20, is the first tennis player to serve as a U.S. flag bearer at an Olympic Games. At Friday's opening ceremony, she will carry the flag alongside basketball great LeBron James.

item.title: Democratic Sen. Bob Casey is up for reelection. Will the switch to Harris help him?
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Democratic Sen. Bob Casey of Pennsylvania about what a Kamala Harris-led presidential ticket would mean for his state. President Biden ended his reelection bid on Sunday.

item.description: The host cities were elected just ahead of the start of the Paris Summer Games this week. The vote comes as finding host cities for the Winter Games has grown more challenging.

item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Jaime Harrison, chair of the Democratic National Committee, about the party's plans to quickly nominate a new candidate for president. Biden dropped out on Sunday.

item.title: With the U.S. bird flu outbreak uncontained, scientists see growing risks
item.description: A recent crop of human cases at a chicken farm highlight the risks of the ongoing outbreak. Here's what scientists fear could happen next in the evolution of the virus.

item.title: Diplomacy has reduced their numbers, but dozens of Americans are still detained abroad
item.description: The number of "unjust detentions" fell 42% over the last two years, according to the nonprofit Foley Foundation. Despite the progress, nations like Russia continue to pose major risks for U.S. travelers.

item.title: Neighbors in Bethel Park are still reeling from the Trump assassination attempt
item.description: Bethel Park, Pa., is the hometown of Thomas Crooks, the 20-year-old who attempted to assassinate President Trump. In the wake of the shooting, residents there are shocked, but are recovering.

item.title: Netanyahu to deliver his 4th address to members of Congress
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu will speak to members of Congress on Wednesday. His words will be watched closely by family members of hostages and by a delegation of soldiers who have fought in Gaza since Oct. 7.

item.title: Voters in the Pittsburgh suburbs react to the new Democratic presidential candidate
item.description: Pennsylvania is a swing state, site of the attempt on ex-President Trump's life, and home of a potential Democratic VP pick. We talk with activists in Pennsylvania about how it's all playing there.
